docs.snippet: The Eagles sold the narrative of a young black player’s suspected gang affiliation to rationalize parting ways with their best receiver....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Eagles sold the narrative of a young black player’s suspected gang affiliation to rationalize parting ways with their best receiver.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column defends NFL star receiver DeSean Jackson, who was released by Philadelphia Eagles after six seasons because of alleged character issues; agrees that Jackson is rambunctious and has occasionally exhibited poor judgement, but argues that the Eagles knew this before giving him a five-year contract extension in 2012; says this was a disgraceful way for a franchise to try to cover its back while releasing its best player.

headline.main: Parting With DeSean Jackson, the Eagles Added a Kick
headline.print_headline: Parting With a Star, and Adding a Kick

docs.snippet: The N.F.L. prospect Johnny Manziel arrives at his draft workout dressed to sell....
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. prospect Johnny Manziel arrives at his draft workout dressed to sell.
docs.abstract: National Football League prospect Johnny Manziel is attracting attention not just for his quarterback skills, but for his choice of fashion during draft workout; wore helmet, shoulder pads and black football jersey with his college number, along with prominent Nike swoosh, which turned out to be planned tie-in to sell replica gear.

headline.seo: Johnny Manziel Arrives at His N.F.L. Workout Dressed to Sell
headline.main: Showing Off More Than His Arm
headline.print_headline: Showing Off More Than His Arm

docs.snippet: The Washington Redskins are offering a bad deal to Indians....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Washington Redskins are offering a bad deal to Indians.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Ojibwe tribe member David Treuer rejects Washington Redskins owner Daniel Snyder's creation of charity Washington Redskins Original Americans Foundation as transparent effort to buy good will and avoid changing team's name; holds systemic changes, not donations, are necessary to improve lives of American Indians; asserts name will change, whether Snyder cooperates or not.

docs.snippet: FIFA’s secretary general, Jérôme Valcke, again raised concerns over Brazil’s World Cup preparations, saying that the stadium for the opening game in São Paulo is among those that worry him most....
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA’s secretary general, Jérôme Valcke, again raised concerns over Brazil’s World Cup preparations, saying that the stadium for the opening game in São Paulo is among those that worry him most.

headline.main: FIFA Executive Says Brazil Is ‘Not Ready’ for World Cup
headline.print_headline: Executive Says Brazil Is ‘Not Ready’ for World Cup

docs.snippet: Barcelona has been barred from acquiring new players until the summer of 2015. The club said it plans to appeal the FIFA penalties....
docs.lead_paragraph: Barcelona has been barred from acquiring new players until the summer of 2015. The club said it plans to appeal the FIFA penalties.
docs.abstract: Barcelona is banned from acquiring new players until the summer of 2015 by FIFA, which is punishing the Spanish club for what it says are repeated violations of the rules for signing teenage players.

headline.main: FIFA Fines and Bans Barcelona From Transfer Market
headline.print_headline: FIFA Fines and Bans Barcelona From Transfer Market

docs.snippet: Seven more footballers from Football League clubs in the north west of England have been arrested following a spot-fixing investigation by British authorities, taking the number suspected to 13....
docs.lead_paragraph: Seven more footballers from Football League clubs in the north west of England have been arrested following a spot-fixing investigation by British authorities, taking the number suspected to 13.

headline.main: Thirteen Arrested in England in Match-Fixing Probe
headline.print_headline: Thirteen Arrested in England in Match-Fixing Probe

docs.snippet: Mistaken identity, it seems, is not the sole reserve of officials in the Premier League with an Italian amateur football match ordered to be replayed after a referee sent off the wrong identical twin....

docs.snippet: A Northwestern University quarterback who is behind a push to unionize the school's football team said on Thursday he is "very confident" that his teammates will vote on April 25 to join the College Athletes Players Association (CAPA)....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Northwestern University quarterback who is behind a push to unionize the school's football team said on Thursday he is "very confident" that his teammates will vote on April 25 to join the College Athletes Players Association (CAPA).

headline.main: Northwestern Quarterback Says 'Confident' of Unionization Vote
headline.print_headline: Northwestern Quarterback Says 'Confident' of Unionization Vote
